description:
DISSIDE uses novel unsupervised learning to select samples that best represent the strongest a
priori discrete pattern in a given data set. It further removes major outliers and "noisy" samples
that do not fit discrete patterns well or represent outliers in groups below a defined n value. It
then estimates the fit and strength of the a priori discrete pattern using both unconstrained and
constrained methods for raw and cleaned data
name: DISSIDE: Dynamic In Silico Sample Identification for Discrete Evaluation
